Notes.Text:
This update for apache-commons-httpclient fixes the following issues:

- http/conn/ssl/SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java ignores the
    http.socket.timeout configuration setting during an SSL handshake,
    which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (HTTPS
    call hang) via unspecified vectors. [bsc#945190, CVE-2015-5262]
- org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier does not properly
    verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the
    subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509
    certificate, which allows MITM attackers to spoof SSL servers
    via a 'CN=' string in a field in the distinguished name (DN)
    of a certificate. [bsc#1178171, CVE-2014-3577]
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2

Vulnerabilities.Description: org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier in Apache HttpComponents HttpClient before 4.3.5 and HttpAsyncClient before 4.0.2 does not properly verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via a "CN=" string in a field in the distinguished name (DN) of a certificate, as demonstrated by the "foo,CN=www.apache.org" string in the O field.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2:apache-commons-httpclient-3.1-11.3.2

Vulnerabilities.Description: http/conn/ssl/SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java in Apache HttpComponents HttpClient before 4.3.6 ignores the http.socket.timeout configuration setting during an SSL handshake, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (HTTPS call hang) via unspecified vectors.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2:apache-commons-httpclient-3.1-11.3.2
